    • Constructor Detail

      • Tower

        public Tower(float x,
             float y,
             processing.core.PImage tower,
             processing.core.PApplet app,
             float range,
             float firespeed,
             float dmg,
             java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> enemies,
             Mana mana)
        Constructor called whenever Tower object is created.
        Parameters:
        x - float indicating x position.
        y - float indicating y position.
        app - a reference of PApplet passed to allow this class to call relevant drawing functions.
        tower - PImage of the sprite.
        range - float indicating how far tower can detect enemies.
        firespeed - float indicating how often tower shoots.
        dmg - float indicating how much to decrease enemy health by if hit.
        enemies - reference to enemies Arraylist to interact with enemy health and positions.
        mana - reference to mana bar to decrease amount.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the tower using x and y positions. Continuously checks if enemy in range using checkEnemyInRange() function. Continously draws upgrades if any using drawUpgrades() function. Checks if paused or ffed, changes the tower fire speed accordingly.

      • upgrade

        public void upgrade(int option)
        This function increases the upgrade based on the number given. For all upgrades, it first checks if the cost is greater than the current mana. If 1, increases range by 32 pixels or 1 tile. Increments the range upgrades counter. If 2, increases speed by half a second by dividing 60 by the desired firing speed, then setting a counter that increments 1/result. Increments the speed upgrade counter. if 3, increases damage by half of the initial damage. Increments the damaage upgrade counter.
        Parameters:
        option - int indicating which upgrade option.

      • showRange

        public void showRange()
        Creates a yellow circle centerd in the middle of the tower to indicate the range the tower can detect and shoot at enemies.

      • getRange

        public float getRange()
        Returns value of the range attribute.
        Returns:
        float of the range value.

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Returns the value of the x attribute.
        Returns:
        float of the x value

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Returns the value of the y attribute.
        Returns:
        float of the y value

      • checkEnemyInRange

        public void checkEnemyInRange()
        Checks whether enemy is in range by calculating the enemy x and y position distance from the tower and comparing against the range, if in range, create a fireball object and add to arraylist of fireballs.

        Iterates through fireball list and if fireball is active, display() and shoot() functions are continuously run.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Sets the paused value to true, and calls pause function in every fireball.

      • unpause

        public void unpause()
        Sets the paused value to false, and calls unpause function in every fireball.

      • ff

        public void ff()
        Sets the ffed value to true, and calls ff function in every fireball.

      • unff

        public void unff()
        Sets the ffed value to false, and calls unff function in every fireball.

      • turnOnUpgrade

        public void turnOnUpgrade()
        Sets upgradesOn attribute to true.

      • turnOffUpgrade

        public void turnOffUpgrade()
        Sets upgradesOn attribute to false.

      • upgradeable

        public boolean upgradeable()
        Returns value of the upgradesOn attribute.
        Returns:
        boolean of upgradesOn value.

      • drawUpgrades

        public void drawUpgrades()
        Checks amount of upgrades of range, speed, damage. Draws circles on the top for every range upgrade, blue square which thickens per speed upgrade, and x for every damage upgrade at the bottom. If all are greater than 0, sprite is upgraded to lvl 2 tower, and amount of circles,border,x drawn are subtracted by 1. If all are greater than 1, sprite is upgraded to lvl 3 tower, and amount of circles,border,x drawn are subtracted by 2.

      • circle

        public void circle(float x,
                   float y,
                   float offset)
        Draws the circles for the upgrades on the tower. Making each circle next to each other by using the offset.
        Parameters:
        x - float indicating x position.
        y - float indicating y position.
        offset - float indicating how much to move right.

      • blueBorder

        public void blueBorder(float x,
                       float y,
                       int thick)
        Draws the blue squares for the upgrades on the tower. Making each upgrade have a thicker blue square by the thickness.
        Parameters:
        x - float indicating x position.
        y - float indicating y position.
        thick - int indicating how thick the stroke should be.

      • xmark

        public void xmark(float x,
                  float y,
                  float offset)
        Draws the x for the upgrades on the tower. Making each x next to each other by using the offset.
        Parameters:
        x - float indicating x position.
        y - float indicating y position.
        offset - float indicating how much to move right.

      • getRangeUpgrades

        public int getRangeUpgrades()
        Returns the value of the initRangeUpgrades attribute.
        Returns:
        amount of times range has been upgraded.

      • getSpeedUpgrades

        public int getSpeedUpgrades()
        Returns the value of the initSpeedUpgrades attribute.
        Returns:
        amount of times speed has been upgraded.

      • getDamageUpgrades

        public int getDamageUpgrades()
        Returns the value of the initDamageUpgrades attribute.
        Returns:
        amount of times damage has been upgraded.
